org.sopra.api.model

Interface Playfield


  • public interface Playfield
    The playfield represents the land where the scenario is located. It consists of playfield elements, tiles that depict a certain type of landscape, mountains, grasslands, beaches, sea, rivers and so on. These playfield elements form a map on which the energy grid is built.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getHorizontalSize()
      Returns the horizontal size of the playfield.
      PlayfieldElement getPlayfieldElement(int x, int y)
      Gets the playfield element at the coordinates x and y if both are within valid ranges (greater or equal to zero and smaller than the horizontal / vertical size.
      int getVerticalSize()
      Returns the vertical size of the playfield.

    • Method Detail

      • getPlayfieldElement

        PlayfieldElement getPlayfieldElement(int x,
                                     int y)
        Gets the playfield element at the coordinates x and y if both are within valid ranges (greater or equal to zero and smaller than the horizontal / vertical size.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate (horizontal coordinate) of the map element to get. Must be greater or equal to zero and smaller than the horizontal size.
        y - The y-coordinate (vertical coordinate) of the map element to get. Must be greater or equal to zero and smaller than the vertical size.
        Returns:
        The map element at (x,y) if it could be found.

      • getVerticalSize

        int getVerticalSize()
        Returns the vertical size of the playfield.
        Returns:
        The vertical size of the playfield.

      • getHorizontalSize

        int getHorizontalSize()
        Returns the horizontal size of the playfield.
        Returns:
        The horizontal size of the playfield.
